page.title: 03Lack of Jobs in S.Wakefield
page.content: From talking to older members of the local community we found that at one time the area had a good deal of local industry. This meant that most people who lived in our area could be employed within it. Today the great houses of Chevet Hall and Kettlethorpe Hall no longer have vast estates to provide jobs; the sandstone quarry at Newmillerdam has gone and only recently the two small coal mines have been closed. Today the area houses people who tend to work in not only the centre of Wakefield but also Leeds,Dewsbury, Barnsley, Sheffield and Doncaster. The increased use of the car and the nearness to our area of the country's main north-south link (Ml) and trans-pennine route (M62) has made our area residential zone bordered to the south by open country.
